channel.title: Question! Real, fast answer please!
channel.description: I got a router, is it possible to portforward through uTorrent? And another question. Will it slow down ur pc. And the last question, isn't it so that if u download uTorrent, everyone can download things from you, or do u need to do something for that first?

item.title: Question! Real, fast answer please!
item.dc:creator: @sjoukjeowns sjoukjeowns
item.description:
@sjoukjeowns wrote:

[quote=“SirPali, post:4, topic:329544”][quote author=sjoukjeowns link=topic=425926.msg3128692#msg3128692 date=1266251256]

Portforwarding with uTorrent does not open a port in your router, just your computer. So no,that wouldn’t solve your problem.
It will not slow down your PC. It just opens a port, thats it.
And no, noone can download stuff from you. Unless you are downloading a torrent, then other people can download that torrent from you.

Stuff you downloaded it will say “uploading” just delete that:|
[/quote]

Yup. But that’s basic torrenting knowledge. Everyone who hasen’t been living under a rock the past year(s) should know that.[/quote]
Yup,

Read full topic

item.title: Question! Real, fast answer please!
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

[quote=“sjoukjeowns, post:3, topic:329544”][quote author=SirPali link=topic=425926.msg3128689#msg3128689 date=1266251180]
Portforwarding with uTorrent does not open a port in your router, just your computer. So no,that wouldn’t solve your problem.
It will not slow down your PC. It just opens a port, thats it.
And no, noone can download stuff from you. Unless you are downloading a torrent, then other people can download that torrent from you.
[/quote]
Stuff you downloaded it will say “uploading” just delete that:|[/quote]

Yup. But that’s basic torrenting knowledge. Everyone who hasen’t been living under a rock the past year(s) should know that.
